marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: With the realization of performance during 9M25, we predict that the consensus is likely to revise up its estimate for UNVR's net profit in 2025F and especially in 2026F. In the last 3 months, the consensus has revised up the 2025F net profit estimate by +14%. Following the 3Q25 performance results, UNVR strengthened by +9.2% in Thursday's (23/10) trading.

marketNews.title: Hal lain yang lagi hot yang perlu kamu ketahui...
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that the money supply in a broad sense (M2) in September 2025 grew by +8% YoY to 9,771.3 trillion rupiah (vs. August 2025: +7.6% YoY). This development was driven by the growth of the narrow money supply (M1) by +10.7% YoY and quasi money by +6.2% YoY. Bloomberg reports that Danantara has recruited 2 former investment professionals from GIC Pte., Daniel Lim and Weihan Wong, as investment directors who will cover the global private market. Bloomberg sources stated that Lim will be assigned to study private credit opportunities, while Wong will be responsible for private equity. Both are reported to carry a global investment mandate, with an initial focus on opportunities in Indonesia. Danantara representatives declined to comment on this news to Bloomberg. The US on Wednesday (22/10) announced new sanctions targeting Russia's two largest oil companies - Rosneft and Lukoil - in an effort to pressure Russia to end the war in Ukraine. The sanctions announcement came 1 day after US President Donald Trump stated that the planned meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Budapest would be postponed indefinitely. Finance Minister, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, stated that the government does not plan to increase the BPJS Health contribution tariff in 2026. Previously, the plan for an increase in the BPJS Health contribution was included in book II of the financial notes along with the 2026 Draft State Budget. Purbaya mentioned that the government will still focus on recovering the domestic economy first. However, Purbaya opens the opportunity to increase the BPJS Health contribution tariff if the Indonesian economy can grow above +6%. Additionally, Purbaya also announced that the government has prepared approximately 20 trillion rupiah to clear the arrears of BPJS Health contributions, although he did not specify the number of participants whose arrears would be cleared.

marketNews.title: Dari Emas ke Energi Hijau
marketNews.content: "Usually what many people suspect is still a long time away, but suddenly it comes sooner!" - husin1030

tickerNews.title: Unilever Indonesia (UNVR) Reports Net Profit +11% YoY for 9M25, Exceeding Expectations
tickerNews.content: Unilever Indonesia ($UNVR) noted a net profit of 1.18 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (+117% YoY, +28% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 3.34 trillion rupiah (+11% YoY), equivalent to 77% of the 2025F consensus estimate. With the run-rate shown since 1Q25, we assess that UNVR has the potential to exceed the 2025F consensus estimate, so we believe the 9M25 realization is above expectations.

tickerNews.title: Improvement Starts to Be Seen in Revenue for UNVR
tickerNews.content: As we wrote previously, UNVR has shown progress in cost improvements in 1Q25-2Q25 and the next challenge is to show the results of these improvements on the revenue side. In 3Q25, UNVR recorded revenue growth of +12% YoY, marking the first annual growth since 3Q23. Although the annual growth level was also caused by a low-base effect in 3Q24, the quarterly revenue level also increased by +8% QoQ and was at a relatively similar level to 1Q25, the period when revenue was boosted by the Eid effect. Positive revenue in 3Q25 was driven by solid volume growth, where UNVR posted an increase in underlying volume in the domestic market of +10% YoY. Segmentally, the 'Home & Personal Care' segment experienced a recovery, recording a revenue growth of +15% YoY, after successively contracting since 4Q23.

tickerNews.title: Efficiency Trend Remains Positive, Costs Related to Restructuring Increase in 4Q25 for UNVR
tickerNews.content: The gross profit margin is getting closer to the ~50% level, rising to 49.2% in 3Q25 (vs. 3Q24: 45.5%, 2Q25: 48%). In the 3Q25 earnings call, UNVR management mentioned that there are still several areas of opportunity to further increase efficiency and/or productivity. However, for 4Q25, management provided guidance that there will be an increase in costs related to the company's restructuring process compared to 3Q25, although annually the figures will not be much different.

tickerNews.title: Dividend Outlook: 2025 Book Year Dividend + Dividend from Ice Cream Business Divestment for UNVR
tickerNews.content: UNVR management stated that the progress of the divestment of the ice cream business is still on-track to be completed in 2025, where the proceeds from this divestment will be distributed as a dividend - as we previously wrote - along with the 100% dividend from the 2025 book year. Based on our estimation, the total dividend prospect from both is approximately 210 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of approximately 9% based on Thursday's (23/10) closing price of 2,260 rupiah per share. Regarding the contribution of the ice cream business, management revealed that during 9M25, the ice cream business generated revenue of approximately 2.8 trillion rupiah (10% of total revenue) and net profit of approximately 270 billion rupiah (8% of total net profit).

tickerNews.title: HMSP Buys Patriot Bond Danantara Worth IDR 500 Billion
tickerNews.content: - $HMSP: Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna announced that the company has purchased 2 series of long-term debt securities from Danantara totaling 500 billion rupiah. The two series of debt securities - known as the patriot bond - consist of 5-year and 7-year tenors and carry indicative nominal interest rates of 2% per year. The total investment value is 1.76% of HMSP's equity.

tickerNews.title: AKR Corporindo (AKRA) Q3 2025 and 9M25 Financial Performance
tickerNews.content: $AKRA: AKR Corporindo recorded a net profit of 470 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+1% YoY, -24% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 1.65 trillion rupiah (+12% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 65% of the 2025F consensus estimate (vs. 3-year average: 64% of annual net profit) and around 63-69% of management's 2025 guidance. Segmentally, Profit Before Tax (PBT) from the 'trading and distribution' segment - which contributed about 70% of total 2024 PBT - weakened in 3Q25 (-2% YoY, -13% QoQ). This result caused the PBT from the 'trading and distribution' segment to grow +18% YoY in 9M25 (vs. 1H25: +30% YoY). On the other hand, PBT from the 'industrial estate' segment was recorded at 79 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+154% YoY, -66% QoQ) due to weak land sales at JIIPE. This was reflected in the revenue from industrial estate land sales reaching only 52 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (-90% QoQ, -70% YoY), even though it was supported by revenue from electricity and utility sales in the industrial estate amounting to 214 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+69% QoQ, +112% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera (NSSS) Reports Net Profit +112% YoY in 3Q25
tickerNews.content: $NSSS: Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera recorded a net profit of 240 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+112% YoY, +58% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 554 billion rupiah (+309% YoY). Revenue in 3Q25 increased to 545 billion rupiah (+41% YoY, +16% QoQ), so revenue for 9M25 increased by +56% YoY to 1.5 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Adhi Karya (ADHI) Records Net Loss of IDR 3.1 Billion in Q3 2025
tickerNews.content: $ADHI: Adhi Karya recorded a net loss of 3.1 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (vs. 3Q24: net profit 56 billion rupiah, 2Q25: net profit 7.2 billion rupiah). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 4.4 billion rupiah (-94% YoY). Revenue in 3Q25 decreased to 1.8 trillion rupiah (-47% YoY, -13% QoQ), so revenue for 9M25 decreased by -38% YoY to 5.7 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Bukalapak (BUKA) Plans to Continue Share Buyback with IDR 420.8 Billion Allocation
tickerNews.content: $BUKA: Bukalapak plans to continue its share buyback with a fund allocation of up to ~420.8 billion rupiah in the period of October 24, 2025-January 23, 2026. This corporate action does not require a GMS, in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability. The fund allocation for this buyback is the remainder from the buyback fund allocation in the periods of July 7-October 6, 2025, and March 26-June 25, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Arwana Citramulia (ARNA) Plans Share Buyback Up to IDR 50 Billion
tickerNews.content: $ARNA: Arwana Citramulia plans to conduct a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to 50 billion rupiah in the period of October 24, 2025-January 23, 2026. This corporate action does not require a GMS, in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Shareholders Approve Appointment of Yulisar Khiat as President Director
tickerNews.content: Medikaloka Hermina shareholders on Thursday (23/10) approved the appointment of Yulisar Khiat as President Director, replacing Hasmoro. Previously, Yulisar served as the company's Finance Director. Meanwhile, Hasmoro was appointed as President Commissioner, with Binsar Parasian Simorangkir as Deputy President Commissioner and Kumala Insiwi Suryo as Independent Commissioner.

tickerNews.title: Jembo Cable Company (JECC) Plans Share Buyback Up to IDR 29.5 Billion
tickerNews.content: Jembo Cable Company ($JECC) plans to conduct a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to ~29.5 billion rupiah in the period of October 23-December 5, 2025. JECC explained that the shares to be repurchased are all shares owned by Fujikura Asia Limited, amounting to ~6.49% of the total shares of the company. This corporate action does not require a GMS, in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability. JECC will conduct the buyback in accordance with the provisions of POJK No. 29/2023 through the negotiation market gradually.

tickerNews.title: Impack Pratama Industri (IMPC) Through Subsidiary Partners with Japanese Company for Eco-Friendly Plastic Waste Processing Project
tickerNews.content: Impack Pratama Industri ($IMPC) through its subsidiary, PT Sirkular Karya Indonesia, announced a collaboration with PT Marubeni Indonesia and PT DNP Indonesia to develop a project for processing plastic waste into environmentally friendly building materials. In this collaboration, plastic waste from PT DNP Indonesia's production facilities will be collected and processed by PT Sirkular Karya Indonesia into various building material products. The processed products will then be marketed nationally.
